boardgame.name: Afrika (second edition)
Afrika II
boardgame.description: Afrika II is a fast-paced game of mobile warfare at the operational level, covering the campaign in North Africa from 1940 until 1942. The heart of the game is the supply system, which highlights the logistical aspect of desert warfare._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Afrika II is a reprint of Afrika: The Northern African Campaign, 1940-1942 (1st edition), the second game in the award wining Standard Combat Series (SCS). Designed to provide players with a low complexity game system that also provides great historical detail and a touch of realism, the SCS is an ideal choice for gamers of all ability levels._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Scale:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Turn: 1 month_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Hex: 10 miles / 16 Km_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Units: Battalion to Division_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Game Inventory:_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 22 x 34_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; map_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 22 x 17_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; map_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One dual-side printed countersheet (280 1/2_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; counters)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 8-page SCS rules booklet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;One 16-page Afrika II game rules booklet_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Players: 2 (suitable for solitaire play)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Playing Time: 3+ hours_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Complexity: Low_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Solitaire Suitability: High_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

This Standard Combat Series game is unpunched and complete, down to the red and white dice and the sheet telling you that a complete copy should have a box and a lid. Said box and lid are tight and with minimal scuffing. Map A, the larger of the two, has a slight curl along one seam, consistent with having been stored flat underneath the game specific rules from the point at which I removed the shrink-wrap to the point at which I realized I was never going to get this game to the table. U.S. Shipping is $6.50 for Priority Mail with Delivery Confirmation. International is Priority International only, exact cost (in the $27-35 range).
